H0.text: What is the opposite of an acid. Alkali

H1.text: What is the opposite of an acid. Neutralizer

H2.text: What is the opposite of an acid. Antacid

H3.text: What is the opposite of an acid. BASE

A4.text: Bases and acids are seen as chemical opposites because the effect of an acid is to increase the hydronium (H3O+) concentration in water, whereas bases reduce this concentration.

A5.text: Bases are generally compounds that can neutralize an amount of acid.

A6.text: Antacids contain alkaline ions that chemically neutralize stomach gastric acid, reducing damage to the stomach lining and esophagus, and relieving pain.

A7.text: An antacid is a substance which neutralizes stomach acidity and is used to relieve heartburn, indigestion, or an upset stomach.
